intro: Dimeria connivens var. roxburghiana, commonly known as the Indian sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features small, fleshy leaves and produces clusters of tiny, white or pale blue flowers. It is native to regions of India and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for studies on desert flora and xerophytic adaptations.
